sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>shellfish</radical> with a <radical>mouth</radical> is a <kanji>member</kanji> of the invertebrate family. Yes, shellfish do have mouths, look it up!
meaningInfo: Imagine a shellfish opening and closing its mouth, talking to you and telling you what a proud member of its family it is. It’s a strange sight, but picture it in your mind anyway.
readingMnemonic: If you were a <kanji>member</kanji> of the same shellfish family, you'd be able to go to the special shellfish <reading>inn</reading> (<ja>いん</ja>). Every species has a members-only inn.
readingInfo: Imagine trying to go to the shellfish inn. Imagine all the members-only signs telling you that you can't come in. Womp womp.
